transliteration:
kharāśvoṣṭramṛgaibhānāmajāvikavadhas tathā |
saṅkarīkaraṇaṃ jñeyaṃ mīnāhimahiṣasya ca || 11.68||
sph_interpretive_translation: The destruction of donkeys, horses, camels, deer, goats, sheep, fish, serpents, and buffaloes constitutes inter-species contamination and is to be recognized as a violation of dharmic order requiring immediate restoration.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the preservation of species integrity
Causation arises from disruption of natural classification
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by proximity to contamination source
Restoration logic requires reversal of inter-species degradation
Consciousness alignment demands recognition of form-specific dharma
executable_legal_axioms: IF action leads to inter-species contamination THEN initiate restoration protocol
IF entity causes death of classified life forms THEN assign completion process based on access level
IF contamination occurs in ecosystem THEN deploy capacity-realignment mechanism
IF consciousness misalignment detected THEN apply sequential purification until dharmic form restored
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, threshold of responsibility is established through causal mapping of contamination event. Authority lies with those capable of executing full reversal. Restoration supersedes punitive measures by mandating systemic realignment at both ecological and consciousness levels.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality identifies precise point of contamination. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures stepwise reversal without residual distortion. Proportional responsibility aligns with capacity to restore. Non-punitive reality rule maintains that suffering cannot correct ontological misalignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate sequential purification of contaminated zones
Assign responsible party to complete species-integrity repair
Deploy consciousness-alignment modules to prevent recurrence
Reintegrate affected ecosystems into dharmic order
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Justice is executed solely for restoration, reintegration, and consciousness realignment. There is no punishment—only correction of deviation from Sanātana Dharma.
